metadata.title: CVE-2019-20925 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An unauthenticated client can trigger denial of service by issuingspecially crafted wire protocol messages, which cause the messagedecompressor to incorrectly allocate memory. This issue affects MongoDBServer v4.2 versions prior to 4.2.1; MongoDB Server v4.0 versions prior to4.0.13; MongoDB Server v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.15 and MongoDB Serverv3.4 versions prior to 3.4.24.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20925` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:3.6.9+really3.6.8+90~g8e540c0b6d-0ubuntu5.3
mongodb-clients - 1:3.6.9+really3.6.8+90~g8e540c0b6d-0ubuntu5.3
mongodb-server - 1:3.6.9+really3.6.8+90~g8e540c0b6d-0ubuntu5.3
mongodb-server-core - 1:3.6.9+really3.6.8+90~g8e540c0b6d-0ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.6.9+really3.6.8+90~g8e540c0b6d-0ubuntu5.3').
